It's almost May 1st; time to SELL IN MAY AND GO AWAY, right? Not if you like money. As usual, it's one of the stock cliches that works less than 50% of the time (41% actually) and leaves you with less money. Stop believing this junk. $ DJIA $ DJI $ SPX $ SPY #study pic.twitter.com/xxPtVeNNs0

Here's an odd one: Here's how well the direction (+ or -) at the end of each month (YTD) predicted the overall direction of the entire year (1900-2016, Dow Jones). It goes as you'd expect, except April, which is a better predictor than May. $ DJIA $ DJI $ SPY $ SPX pic.twitter.com/ONd0VgzNPU

Here's an odd coincidence: Of all the years on the second table (Red But No Worse Than -2%), every year listed except 1940 and 1994 fell within one year (or less) of a noted recession in the US. And of course 1940 was at the end of the Depression. $ DJIA $ DJI $ SPX $ SPY
